humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates the presence of invasive lobular carcinoma with two foci, one measuring 1.9 cm and the other measuring 2.2 cm. Since the larger tumor size is 2.2 cm, which is more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm, the T stage is T2, according to the rules provided. This assessment is based on the size of the largest tumor, regardless of the type of carcinoma or the presence of other conditions such as ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) or lobular carcinoma in situ (LCIS).

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient has two foci of invasive lobular carcinoma, with the largest focus measuring 2.2 cm. According to the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC), T stage for invasive breast cancer is determined by the size of the largest focus. Therefore, since the largest focus is >2 cm but ≤5 cm, the T stage is T2.
